channel.title: Ugh
channel.description:
Sometimes the JVM pisses me off.
I am trying to set up double buffering for my game [code] public Image buff; public Graphics gbuf; ...(later in the code)... buff = createImage(500, 500); gbuf = buff.getGraphics();[/code]
It compiles fine, but at runtime when it gets to [code]gbuf = buff.getGraphics();[/code]
it throws a NullPointerException
How come?

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

I know what it is, you nub.

And I fixed my problem anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

First you need to know what a nullpointer is

Read full topic
